item.title: Building a Serverless Slack clone with Python and Websockets
item.description: In late 2018, API Gateway released support for websockets. This was a really exciting milestone for API Gateway and serverless computing since, historically, serverless APIs were mostly limited to stateless connections. Wouldn’t it be great if we could bring along our serverless architectures as we move to a more real-time style of application development. Well, now we can! You may be thinking, how on earth does this work since Lambda functions (or FaaS, in general) are (mostly) stateless?
